channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Fly tip - 2 chairs and carpet, 1st September
item.description:
2 chairs and a roll of carpet were dumped outside 13 Mead Way some time in the last few days.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Mead Way, Hayes, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flags across Welling, Crook Log and Bexleyheath, 1st September
item.description:
Union Jack and St. George's Cross flags have been tied to lampposts all the way down Welling High Street, along Park View Road and Crook Log, and all the way through Bexleyheath town centre. These have not been organised by the council or the government for a specific national event. They have been attached illegally by individuals, purely to make a hateful, nationalistic statement that only represents these individuals' views. They have the potential to create tensions and divisions that Bexley should absolutely not condone. Statements like these flags are undemocratic and unfairly serve some constituents over others. They have no place on public streets and should be removed immediately.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Park View Road, Welling, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned Vehicle, 1st September
item.description:
We are a registered SNAP parking lorry park. We had this trailer come into site and un hitch the trailer 8 weeks ago. Next week it will owe £1800 in parking fees We have been waiting for the owner to come back but no contact as yet. All documents, number plate, and VOSA papers, have been removed so have no idea who this belongs to. We would like to claim this vehicle and was told first report to Bexley Council for ownership.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hailey Road, Lower Belvedere, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Old road marking now visible again., 1st September
item.description:
When the road layout was changed to single lane the old markings were simply blacked out. Unfortunately they are now very clear again as circled in picture, leading to confusion and occasionally disputes. These poor markings are dangerous and misleading and should be corrected ASAP.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Thurlow Park Road, Dulwich, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overflowing drain, 1st September
item.description:
